title: Provincial Court Family Law Act Protection Order

elements.name: userPreferredService
elements.title: User Preferred Service

elements.name: ApplicantName
elements.title: What is your full name?
elements.description:
This is the name of the person 'making the Protection Order application'. If you are helping someone use this app and they are the ones who will be making the application themselves, use their name. If you are making this application on behalf of another person, use your name.

Use the name as it is written on your primary ID cards. This name will be the most useful.
elements.descFirstName: First Name is also known as Given Name
elements.descMiddleName: If you have more than one Middle Name, write them all in this box with spaces separating your Middle Names
elements.descLastName: Last Name is also known as Family Name or Surname

elements.name: ApplicantDOB
elements.title: What is your date of birth?

elements.name: Lawyer
elements.title: Has a lawyer agreed to receive court documents for you?
elements.description: You do not need a lawyer to use this service.  If you have a lawyer, you can still use this service.

elements.name: FAQLawyer1
elements.title: What if I plan to get a lawyer but I haven't done that yet?
elements.body:
You do not have a lawyer that has agreed to receive court documents for you.

After you get your lawyer, they may help you change the address for receiving court documents to their address.

elements.name: FAQLawyer2
elements.title: What if I used to have a lawyer but not anymore?
elements.body:
You do not have a lawyer that has agreed to receive court documents for you.

You will need to give an address where it is safe for you to receive court documents.

If you already have a Provincial Court Family Law file and you don't have a lawyer anymore, you may need to update your address for service.

Click here to download the form. (This link will open in a new tab.)

elements.name: ExplanationServiceAddress
elements.title:
You need to give an address where it is safe for you to receive court documents. The person protection is needed from will see this address on your court documents.

You do not have to use your home address or the address of where you are staying right now. You can pick an address where you can receive court documents such as your workplace, a family member's home or a friend's home.

elements.name: ApplicantAddress
elements.title: What is a safe address where you can receive court documents?
elements.description: The person making you (or your family) feel unsafe may need to send you court documents to this address.

elements.name: ApplicantContact
elements.title: Contact Information
elements.description: The person making you (or your family) feel unsafe will see this contact information on your court documents.

elements.name: LawyerName
elements.title: What is your lawyer's full name?

elements.name: LawyerAddress
elements.title: What is your lawyer's address?

elements.name: LawyerContact
elements.title: Lawyer's Contact Information

elements.name: ApplicantOccupation
elements.title: What is your job or profession?
elements.description: For example: Nurse, Homemaker, Carpenter, Accountant, etc.

elements.name: RespondentName
elements.title: Who is the person that protection is needed from?
elements.description: If you know how their name is written on their ID cards, that will be the most useful.

elements.name: RespondentDOBExact
elements.title: Do you know {RespondentName}'s exact date of birth?
elements.description: You can still use this service without this information. A Protection Order is most effective with this information.

elements.name: RespondentDOB
elements.title: What is {RespondentName}'s date of birth?

elements.name: RespondentAddress
elements.title: What is an address where {RespondentName} can receive court documents?
elements.description:
You can pick a daytime address such as {RespondentName}'s workplace or somewhere you know {RespondentName} will be staying.

If you don't have an address for {RespondentName}, fill out as much information as you know. The rest can be left blank.

elements.name: RespondentContact
elements.title: Contact Information

elements.name: ApplicantNeedsProtection
elements.title: Do you, {ApplicantName}, need to be protected from {RespondentName}, on this `Protection Order`?
elements.description: A judge will review what you are asking for and decide on the conditions for your protection order.

elements.name: ExplanationApplicantNeedsNoProtection
elements.title: You can still use this service to protect your children, or to apply for a protection order on behalf of another adult, even if you do not need to be protected from {RespondentName} on this Protection Order.

elements.name: anotherAdultPO
elements.title: Are you applying for a Protection Order on behalf of another adult?

elements.name: anotherAdultName
elements.title: What is the Adult's full name?

elements.name: anotherAdultDOB
elements.title: What is the Adult's date of birth?

elements.name: anotherAdultReasonForPO
elements.title: Please explain why you are applying for {anotherAdultName}

elements.name: childPO
elements.title: Do you have a child that needs to be protected from {RespondentName}, on this Protection Order?

elements.name: childName
elements.title: What is the name of the child?

elements.name: childDOB
elements.title: What is the child's date of birth?

elements.name: childRelationship
elements.title: What is the child's relationship with {RespondentName}?

elements.name: notMyChildFAQ
elements.title: Do you need Protection Order for the child of the person you are applying for?
elements.body: If it's not your child but child of the person you are applying for please contact Child Protection Services

elements.name: anotherAdultSharingResi
elements.title: Is there another adult sharing a residence with the protected person that needs to be protected from {RespondentName}, on this Protection Order?

elements.name: sharingResidenceFAQ
elements.title: Does this include a roommate?
elements.body:
No, a family law protection order can be made 
only to protect an at-risk family member from another family member. An adult person, who lives with an at-risk family member, and is a relative of the at-risk person 
(even if they are not related to the person they need protection from) is included in the Family Law Act definition of a `family member`. This usually would 
include grandparents, parents, siblings, or other relatives of the at-risk family member. If you have a roommate that needs protection, 
they should apply for a `Peace Bond`.

elements.name: anotherAdultSharingResiName
elements.title: What is the name of adult sharing the residence with you?

elements.name: anotheradultSharingResiDOB
elements.title: What is the date of birth of the adult sharing the residence with you?

elements.name: anotherAdultSharingResiRelation
elements.title: What is {anotherAdultSharingResiName} relationship to the protected person(s)?

elements.name: ExistingFamilyCase
elements.title: Is there already a Family Law file open between {ApplicantName} and {RespondentName} in the Provincial Court of British Columbia?
elements.description: An open file could mean that documents have been filed at the courthouse but a judge may not have made an order yet.

elements.name: ExistingFamilyCaseFAQ
elements.title: If I have a Family Law file open in the Supreme Court of British Columbia, should I include that?
elements.body: No, the file numbers are different between Provincial and Supreme Court. If you already have a Provincial Court file number, you will want to make sure that this document gets filed with the same file number.

elements.name: ExistingCourt
elements.title: Court Location

elements.name: ExistingFileNumber
elements.title: File Number

elements.name: ExistingOrders
elements.title: Has any court ever made an `order` between {ApplicantName} and {RespondentName} about your separation, your children or `support`?
elements.description: An order can be made in any court in any place, including the Supreme Court or Criminal Court.

elements.name: ExplanationExistingOrders
elements.title: You will need to include a photocopy of your court order(s) when you file your documents at the courthouse. You will be reminded to make a photocopy at the end of the service.

elements.name: anyExistingOrder
elements.title: Please add any existing orders in the fields below. If you need to add another order, click the 'Add Order' button. If you are done entering all existing orders, you can move on to the next question.

elements.name: ExistingWrittenAgreements
elements.title: Are there any other `written agreements` between {ApplicantName} and {RespondentName} about your separation, your children or `support`?
elements.description: For example, a separation agreement or a mediation agreement.

elements.name: ExplanationExistingWrittenAgreements
elements.title: You will need to include a photocopy of your written agreement(s) when you file your documents at the courthouse. You will be reminded to make a photocopy at the end of the service.

elements.name: anyExistingAgreements
elements.title: Please add any existing agreements in the fields below. If you need to add another agreement, click the 'Add Agreement' button. If you are done entering all existing agreements, you can move on to the next question.

templateElements.name: writtenAgreementInCourtText
templateElements.title: If you have filed the written agreement with a court, please also indicate the court location and court file number.  These fields are optional.

elements.name: NoContactRespondentSummary
elements.title:
If the judge decides to make your `Protection Order`, {RespondentName} will be ordered to stay away from you or your children or both. If {RespondentName} doesn't follow the Protection Order, they may face criminal charges.

The following questions will guide you to personalize your safety needs for your Protection Order.

elements.name: RespondentLiveTogether
elements.title: Does the protected party(ies) ({ApplicantName}) currently share a home with {RespondentName}?
elements.description: Even if one of you has left home temporarily, you still share a home.

elements.name: RespondentLeaving
elements.title: Do you, {ApplicantName}, or your children want to stay in this family home?

elements.name: RespondentNeedPolice
elements.title: Do you think you need the police to remove {RespondentName} from where you or your children live, or will {RespondentName} leave on their own?

choices.text: I need police assistance to remove {RespondentName} from the home
{RespondentName} will probably leave on their own

elements.name: FamilyHomeAddress
elements.title: What is the address of your family home?

elements.name: RespondentHasStuff
elements.title: Does {RespondentName} have any of you or your children's personal belongings?
elements.description: Personal belongings means things that you or your children need for daily life. This includes clothing, personal hygiene products, personal electronics and personal documents that are difficult to replace.

elements.name: RespondentHasStuffPolice
elements.title: Do you need a police officer to supervise while you get the personal belongings?
elements.description: A judge can order a police officer to come with you to get the personal belongings.

elements.name: RespondentHasStuffAddress
elements.title: What is the address where your personal belongs are being held?

elements.name: RespondentNeedsStuff
elements.title: Do you or your children have any of {RespondentName}'s personal belongings?
elements.description: Personal belongings means things that {RespondentName} needs for daily life. This includes clothing, personal hygiene products, personal electronics and personal documents that are difficult to replace.

elements.name: RespondentNeedsStuffPolice
elements.title: Do you, {ApplicantName}, need the police to supervise {RespondentName} while they get their personal belongings?
elements.description: A judge can order a police officer to be there when {RespondentName} comes to get their personal belongings.

elements.name: RespondentNoGo
elements.title: Are there any places where you want {RespondentName} to stay away from?

elements.name: RespondentNoGoPlaces
elements.title: Select the places where you want {RespondentName} to stay away from:
elements.description: If you select "Other" and need to write more than 1 place, write them all and separate each place with a comma.

elements.name: ExplanationNoGoAddresses
elements.title: For this service, you do not need to give the addresses of the places you want {RespondentName} to stay away from. However, the judge may request them for the Protection Order so be prepared to bring the addresses into the courtroom with you.

elements.name: RespondentApplicantThirdPartyContact
elements.title:
Even with a Protection Order in place, you, {ApplicantName}, and {RespondentName} will be allowed to be in the same courtroom together for court purposes.

Outside of the courtroom, are there any third parties that you want to communicate though, for ongoing court purposes with {RespondentName}?
elements.description: Examples of third parties may include a lawyer, a family justice counsellor or a mutual friend.

elements.name: RespondentApplicantContactType
elements.title: Select any third parties that you, {ApplicantName}, and {RespondentName} may communicate through, for ongoing court purposes:

elements.name: RespondentApplicantContactOther
elements.title: Is there any other situation that {RespondentName} would need to communicate with you, {ApplicantName}?

elements.name: RespondentApplicantContactOtherReason
elements.title: Describe the situation(s)?

elements.name: RespondentFirearms
elements.title: Do you think {RespondentName} would threaten or harm you or your children with guns, explosives or any other kind of firearm?
elements.description: Click here for more information about how firearms and explosive substances are defined in the Criminal Code of Canada.

elements.name: RespondentFirearmsYes
elements.title: Do you think {RespondentName} has guns, explosives or any other kind of firearm?

elements.name: RespondentWeapons
elements.title: Do you think {RespondentName} would threaten or harm you or your children with weapons that are not guns or explosives?
elements.description: Everyday objects like a kitchen knife, a baseball bat or a hammer, could be used as weapons.

elements.name: RespondentWeaponsYes
elements.title: Do you think {RespondentName} own any weapons that are not everyday objects, guns or explosives?
elements.description:
Do not answer "YES" for everyday objects like a kitchen knife, baseball bat or a hammer.

Examples of weapons that someone may own include hunting knifes, bows and arrows, swords, nunchucks, brass knuckles or throwing stars.

elements.name: RespondentNoWeapons
elements.title:
By answering "NO" to the questions above, you believe there is no need for a judge to order {RespondentName} not to have any weapons or firearms. If there is a concern about {RespondentName} having or using weapons or firearms, go back to the questions above and answer "YES."

If you have no concerns about weapons or firearms, please confirm by checking the statement below.

choices.text: I have no concern over weapons or firearms.

elements.name: howPartiesRelated
elements.title: Describe how the protected party/parties and the other party are related for the purposes of application

elements.name: ifChildPOFAQ
elements.title: If the protection order is only for the protection of a child(ren), please answer the following question for the parents or guardians of the child(ren).

elements.name: werePOPartiesMarried
elements.title: The parties are or have been spouses (married or lived in a marriage-like relationship for at least 2 years)

elements.name: liveTogetherPODate
elements.title: Date on which the parties began to live together in a marriage-like relationship

elements.name: dateOfMarriagePO
elements.title: Date of marriage

elements.name: isSeperatedPO
elements.title: Are the protected party and the other party currently separated
elements.description: Spouses may be separated while continuing to live in the same residence

elements.name: separationDate
elements.title: Parties separated on

elements.name: planningToSeparatePO
elements.title: Are the protected party and the other party planning to separate?

elements.name: mentalHealthConcernPO
elements.title: I have concerns about the mental health of the protected party and/or the other party

elements.name: explainReasonsPO
elements.title: Explain the reasons for your concerns

elements.name: riskOfViolencePO
elements.title: Are there circumstances that may increase the risk of family violence

elements.name: describeCirumstancesPO
elements.title: Describe the circumstances such as:  substance abuse, employment or financial difficulties, relationship status, criminal history, pregnancy, threats to you/another person/child/animal, stalking, forced sex, controlling behaviour, release from prison, strangling/choking/biting, threats or attempts to commit suicide, cultural religious beliefs or any other circumstances

elements.name: existingPOOrders
elements.title: There are existing court orders protecting one of the parties or restraining contact between the parties, including protection orders, peace bonds, restraining orders, bail conditions or other criminal orders

elements.name: otherPartyDisobeyOrder
elements.title: Has the other party ever failed to obey a court order?

elements.name: describeDisobeyOrder
elements.title: Describe the circumstances

elements.name: concernForNotObeying
elements.title: I have concerns the other party may not obey a court order

elements.name: explainReasonsForConcern
elements.title: Explain the reason for your concerns

elements.name: reportedConcernsToPolice
elements.title: I have reported my safety concerns to the police

elements.name: describeActionsByPolice
elements.title: Describe what action the police have taken

elements.name: reportedConcernsToSW
elements.title: I have reported my safety concerns to a social worker (Ministry of Children and Family Development)

elements.name: desrcibeSWAction
elements.title: Describe what action the social worker have taken

elements.name: PORSpeedNormalAffidavit
elements.title: Do you, {ApplicantName}, want to use this service to write an `affidavit`?
elements.description:
An affidavit is one of the ways you will tell your story to the court. Most judges will require that you write an affidavit, but others may not.
A judge may also ask you to tell your story, under oath, in court.

elements.name: ExplanationPORSpeedNormalAffidavitNo
elements.title:
Most judges will require that you write an affidavit. If you do not want to use this service to write an affidavit, you have other options:
  • Click here for the PDF form
  • Get a paper form at a courthouse registry. Click here for a list of courthouse locations
  • Get a lawyer to help you write one

elements.name: ExplanationPORSpeedNormalAffidavitYes
elements.title:
In your affidavit, tell your story in your own words. Include all the facts that you think the judge may need. Everything you say must to be true to the best of your knowledge.

You can include information that you got from someone else, but you must include who told you, when they told you and that you believe what they said is true. For example, you can include information that your child has told you.

The next questions are for your affidavit.

Click here to get tips for writing your affidavit.

elements.name: ExplanationPORSpeedup
elements.title:
The court will need a reason why you need your Protection Order sooner. The way you will tell your reason to the court is with an `affidavit`. This service will help you write an affidavit.

An affidavit is one of the ways you will tell your story to the court. A judge may also ask you to tell your story, under oath, in court.

In your affidavit, tell your story in your own words. Include all the facts that you think the judge may need. Everything you say must to be true to the best of your knowledge.

You can include information that you got from someone else, but you must include who told you, when they told you and that you believe what they said is true. For example, you can include information that your child has told you.

The next 4 questions are for your affidavit.

Click here to get tips for writing your affidavit.

elements.name: ExplanationPORNoNotice
elements.title:
The court will need a reason why they should hear your story without hearing {RespondentName}'s story. The way you will tell your reason to the court is with an `affidavit`. This service will help you write an affidavit.

An affidavit is one of the ways you will tell your story to the court. A judge may also ask you to tell your story, under oath, in court.

In your affidavit, tell your story in your own words. Include all the facts that you think the judge may need. Everything you say must to be true to the best of your knowledge.

You can include information that you got from someone else, but you must include who told you, when they told you and that you believe what they said is true. For example, you can include information that your child has told you.

The next 4 questions are for your affidavit.

Click here to get tips for writing your affidavit.

elements.name: ExplanationWhyPONeeded
elements.title: The next set of questions will help the court understand why you are asking for a protection order.  A judge can make decisions based only on the information presented by the parties as evidence.  Evidence must be relevant to the issue.

elements.name: whatViolence
elements.title: What `Family Violence` do you fear?
elements.description: You do not need to use any special wording.  The key is to be clear about what you mean.

elements.name: whyViolence
elements.title: Why do you fear `Family Violence` is likely to happen?
elements.description: You can state the reason(s) why you are afraid of the other party and think family violence may occur.  You do not need to use any special wording.  The key is to be clear about what you mean.  You will have an opportunity later to describe any past incidents, if there have been any.

elements.name: describeThreats
elements.title: Describe the behaviour or threats that concern you.
elements.description: What are some examples of the other party's behaviour, or threats they have made, that have you worried for the safety of you and/or the protected party/parties.

elements.name: recentIncidents
elements.title: Describe any recent incidents of family violence against {ApplicantName}.
elements.description:
Start with the most recent incident continuing backwards as far as you think it is important for the court to know. Tell your story in your own words. Everything you say must be true to the best of your knowledge. You can include information that you got from someone else, but you must include who told you, when they told you and that you believe what they said is true. You do not need to use any special wording but it is important that you are clear and provide as much detail as possible, including:
  • the date the incident occurred
  • a description of the incident of family violence
  • who was involved (including any witnesses or the police)
  • the child(ren)'s involvement in the incident, if applicable
  • any injuries or trauma from the incident
  • any other detail about the incident you feel it is important for the court to know


Note: If there is a police report, medical report or doctor's note, or any photographs related to the incident, you must talk about them in this section and attach them as exhibits. To include something as an exhibit, you must talk about it and state that it is attached as an exhibit. Each exhibit gets a letter assigned to it, starting with 'A' and continuing through the alphabet. For example, the police report attached as Exhibit A.

elements.name: recentIncidentWithChild
elements.title: Describe any recent incidents of family violence against {ApplicantName} and {childName}.
elements.description:
Start with the most recent incident continuing backwards as far as you think it is important for the court to know. Tell your story in your own words. Everything you say must be true to the best of your knowledge. You can include information that you got from someone else, but you must include who told you, when they told you and that you believe what they said is true. You do not need to use any special wording but it is important that you are clear and provide as much detail as possible, including:
  • the date the incident occurred
  • a description of the incident of family violence
  • who was involved (including any witnesses or the police)
  • the child(ren)'s involvement in the incident, if applicable
  • any injuries or trauma from the incident
  • any other detail about the incident you feel it is important for the court to know


Note: If there is a police report, medical report or doctor's note, or any photographs related to the incident, you must talk about them in this section and attach them as exhibits. To include something as an exhibit, you must talk about it and state that it is attached as an exhibit. Each exhibit gets a letter assigned to it, starting with 'A' and continuing through the alphabet. For example, the police report attached as Exhibit A.

elements.name: otherPartyDynamicPanel
elements.title: Please add the details of the other party in the fields below. If you need to add another party, click the 'Add Other Party' button. If you are done entering all the parties, you can move on to the next question

templateElements.name: OtherPartyName
templateElements.title: Insert name of the other Party

templateElements.name: doYouKnowDOB
templateElements.title: Do you know  {panel.OtherPartyName} exact date of birth?

templateElements.name: otherPartyAddress
templateElements.title: What is an address where {panel.OtherPartyName} can receive court documents?

elements.name: dateOfPO
elements.title: On what date was the Protection Order you want changed made?

elements.name: terminateDateOfPO
elements.title: On what date was the Protection Order you want terminated made?

elements.name: inCourtForPO
elements.title: Were you in court when the Protection Order was made?

elements.name: whyNotInCourt
elements.title: Please explain why you were not in Court

elements.name: kindofPartyIbPO
elements.title: In the Protection Order I am:

elements.name: whatChangesNeeded
elements.title: What changes are you asking for?

elements.name: whyChangesNeeded
elements.title: Why do you want these changes?

elements.name: whyTerminatePO
elements.title: Why do you want the order terminated?

elements.name: urgencyPOInfo
elements.title:
Normally, you need to give notice to {RespondentName} that you are applying for a `Protection Order`. You give notice to {RespondentName} by having the application documents served personally to {RespondentName}.

The period of time between the day that {RespondentName} is served and the day that the application is heard is called the "notice period" or "notice".
Normally, you must serve the other party with at least 7 days' notice of the court appearance.
A judge can decide to change the amount of notice you give {RespondentName} if {RespondentName} can be served but your situation requires a court order sooner than 7 days.

A judge can also decide to review your application without {RespondentName} being given notice until after the Protection Order is made if notice on {RespondentName} is unreasonable because of special circumstances like you or your children are in imminent danger of harm, or providing notice in advance would probably have serious consequences.

elements.name: PORSpeedUp
elements.title: Normally, {RespondentName} will need to be given notice that you are applying for a Protection Order at least 7 days before the date scheduled for court. Do you need this Protection Order application to be heard sooner (you will be asking the court to be allowed to give less than 7 days' notice to {RespondentName} )?

elements.name: PORDaysToNotice
elements.title: How many days' notice do you want to give {RespondentName}?

elements.name: whyAllowNotice
elements.title: Explain why you want a judge to allow you to give {RespondentName} {PORDaysToNotice} days' notice of your application?
elements.description:
Provide the facts you want the court to consider, including:
  • why {RespondentName} should be given less than 7 days' notice?
  • why the application or your situation is urgent or what special circumstances exist?
  • what do you believe will happen if you have to wait 7 days to have the application heard?

elements.name: PORNoNotice
elements.title:
Normally, a judge will want to hear from you, {ApplicantName} and {RespondentName} before making a decision.

Do you want a judge to make their decision before {RespondentName} gets to tell their story?

elements.name: PORWhyNoNotice
elements.title: Explain why you want a judge to make their decision before {RespondentName} gets to tell their story.
elements.description:
Provide the facts you want the court to consider, including:
  • why {RespondentName} should not be given notice?
  • why the application or your situation is urgent or what special circumstances exist?
  • what do you believe will happen if {RespondentName} is served or given notice of your application and a chance to attend court at the same time as you?
